at Symphony Space, May 8th   The NYU Symphony, the premier orchestral ensemble at NYU Steinhardt, will present a concert featuring Philip Glass’s Concerto Fantasy for Two Timpanists and Orchestra, Valgeir Sigurðsson’s Dreamland, and works by the 2015 NYU Steinhardt Composition Competition Winners Brian Haller and Brian Paul. …      (Read Story)           Institute for Education and Social Policy Finds Small High School Reform Boosts Districtwide Outcomes   Creating small high schools improves outcomes for students in the overall school district – both in new small schools and existing larger schools – according to a study of New York City schools by researchers at New York University, Syracuse …      (Read Story)           Secrets of the Sari Revealed at Costume Studies Event, May 2nd   Few styles of women’s dress are as enduring as the sari – the classic, unstitched garment worn by women in India for more than 2,000 years. On Saturday, May 2, one of the world’s foremost historians of the sari, Rta …      (Read Story)            More News... Undergraduate    Dual Degree    Master's    Advanced Certificate    Doctoral     Summer         Kodály Summer Institute     IMPACT     Performamatics     Summer Course Offerings         Study Abroad        Curriculum       Undergraduate    Master's    Advanced Certificate    Doctoral        Auditions   People      Faculty    Students    Alumni       Teacher Certification   Ensembles   FAQ    Media                    Welcome to Music Education                     Overview Video       John Gilbert Discusses the Music Education Program             News       NYU Stories Interviews Alex Ruthmann    Play With Your Music    Join the NYU Alumni Choir    S. Alex Ruthmann Joins Music Education Faculty    Music Education Hackday    NYU Singers visit Abu Dhabi    Music Ed Alum Núñez Earns 2011 MacArthur Award    Check out Photos from NYU's Madrigal singers at Saks Fifth Avenue    View New Choral Arts Society Video    Announcing New BMus / MA Music Ed Dual Degree    NYU receives MENC Collegiate Membership Chapter Growth Recognition Award       Selected Events       Summer Music Education / Kodály workshop       Featured Students       Read about our current students    Current Master's student, Peter Douskalis, receives great reviews for debut CD from All About Jazz and Just Jazz Guitar           Teacher Education AT NYU STEINHARDT        Our NYU Music Education Program is dedicated to developing artistic, reflective, and creative music educators for careers in schools, the community and private settings.    Our B.M., M.A., and Ph.D. music education majors perform and study with New York's finest classical, jazz, music theater, world music performers, and artist-teachers.    Through our programs you have access to:       an internationally renowned faculty of music education scholars    Greenwich Village and New York City, the cultural capital of the world    supervised teaching placements and internships in New York's finest public, private, and community music schools    diverse learners in multicultural environments    unparalleled music technology facilities    NYU's study abroad programs in Prague, Florence, and 25 other cities on four continents    arts education consortiums including music, art, dance and theater       All of these opportunities take full advantage of a warm and collegial Department of Music and Performing Arts Professions that offers an exceptional range of program electives including Performance, Music Technology, Composition, Educational Theatre, Dance Education, Music Therapy, Music Theatre and Classical Voice, Jazz Studies, and more.    The NYU Steinhardt Teacher Education Program is fully accredited by the Teacher Education Accreditation Council.    B.M., M.A., Advanced Certificate, Ph.D.    To speak to us personally, or to arrange a visit, please contact our advisors:    Undergraduate Music Education: Prof. Ira Shankman Graduate Music Education (M.A.), contact: Prof. Nancy Shankman Graduate Music Education (M.A.) and Advanced Certificate, contact: Dr. John Gilbert Ph.D., contact: Dr. David J. Music and Performing Arts                        The Department of Music and Performing Arts Professions offers four doctoral programs in the following areas:       Music Performance and Composition    Music Education    Educational Theatre    Music Technology       These pages provide information and links relevant to the application process, the curriculum and requirements of our programs, important deadlines for our doctoral students, as well as the policies and guidelines that govern doctoral studies in our department.    The director of Doctoral Studies for the department is Dr. Philip Taylor. He coordinates various stages and committees involved in doctoral study, addresses questions and concerns from students and faculty, and works closely with the directors of each program in setting and enforcing doctoral policies.                   Welcome to Music Education                     Overview Video       John Gilbert Discusses the Music Education Program             News       NYU Stories Interviews Alex Ruthmann    Play With Your Music    Join the NYU Alumni Choir    S. Alex Ruthmann Joins Music Education Faculty    Music Education Hackday    NYU Singers visit Abu Dhabi    Music Ed Alum Núñez Earns 2011 MacArthur Award    Check out Photos from NYU's Madrigal singers at Saks Fifth Avenue    View New Choral Arts Society Video    Announcing New BMus / MA Music Ed Dual Degree    NYU receives MENC Collegiate Membership Chapter Growth Recognition Award       Selected Events       Summer Music Education / Kodály workshop       Featured Students       Read about our current students    Current Master's student, Peter Douskalis, receives great reviews for debut CD from All About Jazz and Just Jazz Guitar           Teacher Education AT NYU STEINHARDT        Our NYU Music Education Program is dedicated to developing artistic, reflective, and creative music educators for careers in schools, the community and private settings.    Our B.M., M.A., and Ph.D. music education majors perform and study with New York's finest classical, jazz, music theater, world music performers, and artist-teachers.    Through our programs you have access to:       an internationally renowned faculty of music education scholars    Greenwich Village and New York City, the cultural capital of the world    supervised teaching placements and internships in New York's finest public, private, and community music schools    diverse learners in multicultural environments    unparalleled music technology facilities    NYU's study abroad programs in Prague, Florence, and 25 other cities on four continents    arts education consortiums including music, art, dance and theater       All of these opportunities take full advantage of a warm and collegial Department of Music and Performing Arts Professions that offers an exceptional range of program electives including Performance, Music Technology, Composition, Educational Theatre, Dance Education, Music Therapy, Music Theatre and Classical Voice, Jazz Studies, and more.    The NYU Steinhardt Teacher Education Program is fully accredited by the Teacher Education Accreditation Council.    B.M., M.A., Advanced Certificate, Ph.D.    To speak to us personally, or to arrange a visit, please contact our advisors:    Undergraduate Music Education: Prof. Ira Shankman Graduate Music Education (M.A.), contact: Prof. Nancy Shankman Graduate Music Education (M.A.) and Advanced Certificate, contact: Dr. John Gilbert Ph.D., contact: Dr. David J.
